context: Ryan aligns FOS concepts with ConOps abstractions, intentionally limiting fidelity to preserve document purpose. He later answers follow-up technical questions consistently without reopening prior alignment decisions.

text.msg: Hey Nick, I've been stuck on a call, sorry for blowing past our calendar time...
Joe and I just discussed the FOS and how we can align the ConOps to it... ConOps does not need the fidelity that is in your document...
That's great feedback. I told Joe earlier that I'd rather not derail the conops description, rather explore what minimal language we can change to make the abstractions fit together...
Quick question, is Density Altitude checked against before dispatching a flight?
Potentially. It depends if density altitude variations/extremes are built into energy/performance limitations...
Asking cause someone asked that in the ODD
I think we list it in the dispatch items that could be checked. We haven't decided if that's on the authoritative "should" be checked list yet
Okay cool, thanks, will describe it in that way

internal.thought: I want to preserve the integrity of the ConOps abstraction rather than forcing my document's fidelity into it.
I answer precisely but leave intentional ambiguity where decisions are not yet locked.
Consistency matters more than completeness at this stage; future decisions can harden the language.
